page.title: 06SCHOOLS
page.content: There are schools in both villages. Both are long established, and both, after many years of dwindling rolls, now have fairly settled annual populations of about 50 pupils. Because they are fairly small, there is a close-knit "family" atmosphere about the schools, and the visitor's first impression is that they are happy, lively places, where the children enjoy their school day. Although basically rural in nature, there is close liaison with surrounding schools of the same type, and there is is healthy competition in the football/netball leagues in which even the smallest schools compete. Thevillage schools are focal points for the communities, and there is much two way co-operation, communication and support between school and community.
